text: @austin.269 Refute my posts with reserached facts from credible, unbiased and recognized news sources or slither back under rocks.
@jlanoue555, Stay in school at least until your reading comprehension improves!!
@jlanoue555 I said zero about a woman choosing to be in a room with men. Your post is irrelevant. Move along.
@pattykwazz and that's her choice. That's not oppression that's your own life choices
I thought it was gonna be really sexist and what not but I was pleasantly surprised. 👏🏼

@evannbrooks Also, I understand feeling defensive if you’re not a person who needs a commercial like this, regardless tho, some kids might need to be literally told this if they’re growing up with a father who abuses their mom, ya know? It’s not the worst thing in the world to spread good messages is all.
@evannbrooks lol I thought I delete one of the comments when I wrote it, which is why I repeated a ton of shit in them. Anyway, thanks.
My husband sent me a bunch of memes mocking the fragile masculinity of the men who took offense to the ad before I even heard of it myself. I'm lucky...
They thought it was cringy and thought-policing.

@evannbrooks I really just want to know how femininity is as toxic as masculinity? If it were feminism would be call equalism or masculinism or more likely just wouldn’t be a thing? I don’t understand why men think feminism is useless and unneeded when women would literally still be stuck with no voting rights, sexual health rights, human rights, property etc etc etc without it. Which proves your statement to be wrong. Also, femininity isn’t violent against masculinity. Women presidents don’t go around joking about sexually harassing men and grabbing dicks for fun. The patriarchy doesn’t make life difficult or scary for men in any mwah the way it does for women. Please tell me how femininity is ruining men’s lives all over the world ?

@evannbrooks also, it IS hatred. Because if men loved women, every time this topic were brought up I wouldn’t have to keep defending the fact that a struggle even exists for women, ir explaining how femininity is not as toxic as masculinity, which like I already said, if it were genuinely as toxic, then feminism would be called equalism, or it would be called masculism, or more likely it just wouldn’t be a thing. If it weren’t a deep rooted hatred then the reactions against this video wouldn’t be anger and violent words, when the video is NOT saying that all men are bad or rapists. It’s hurtful. And I think it’s so hurtful because I’ve had 26 years of hearing horrible things comes out of the mouths of men I love, and the worst part is they never even realize it care about how much it hurts. Instead, their ego is more important. Just like every man angry about this commercial. (Also I’m genuinely not trying to be insulting, this is honestly how I feel and I’d like men to be understanding)

@evannbrooks I just wanted to address your last sentence. The reason there would never be an ad like this for women is because men never needed an entire movement to stop violence against men, or to gain the right to vote, or to own their own property. It’s called FEMinism because women have been hurt by the patriarchy for a very long time. If you care about and love women, then this commercial shouldn’t be offensive. It actually hurts my heart that men hate us so much that this commercial offends them. It really makes me cry sometimes.
We still need feminism because a man in a room filled with women is estatic. A woman in a room filled with men is terrified.
My brother: “Gillette doesn’t care about women. If they did they’d help to end the pink tax and do an ad about THAT.” ... he’s not wrong.
I’m glad that most of the men in my life were fine with it...
